page.title: 12Begg Farm, Kirkcaldy
page.content: The {Begg farm}is of 550 acres most of which is grazing for cattle. About one quarter is for wheat, barley, oats, peas and potatoes. There are four kinds of cattle : Ayrshire, Holstein, Fresians and Romanola. Bullocks and lambs are brought in for fattening over the Winter. In another part of the farm is a disused milking parlour which had to abandoned when the European Community decided to cut the amount of milk that farmers were allowed to produce. This would reduce the European 'milk lake'. Cattle from the farm have won prizes at agricultural shows throughout Scotland. A new crop that is being grown is oil-seed rape which has a very bright yellow flower. The crop produces oil for using in cattle food.
